page.title: 05SUDBOROUGH RIDING SCHOOL 1
page.content: Sudborough riding school has been open for eight years,since 1977. The riding school has 25 horses and ponies including one in retirement. These horses are ridden by both the young and the old, and also by the R.D.A. (Riding for the Disabled). Once a year in the summer under privileged students from the east end of London come to the school to ride. These people pay special fees. The fees at the riding school are : Teaching lessons Â£5 per hour Riding out Â£6 per 1\ hours There is also a new indoor riding centre.The staff at the school totals approximately 18 including some part- timers who sometimes work for their lessons.
